availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Allen Freeman Qualls (Hopkins Co., farmer and pvt 17th ky cav )

body.p: Granville County, North Carolina and Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. North Carolina native. Father of James M. Qualls. Son of James Qualls and Judy Qualls. Student in Granville County, North Carolina, in 1850. Farm laborer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 3, 1865, to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, North Carolina, Granville County, Fort Creek, p. 116B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 593.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 2, p. 40A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 406.
"Allen Freeman Qualls (1834-1916)," Find A Grave, Memorial #70096121, accessed August 5, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70096121.
